message.content:
{"id": "35156", "title": "Ctrl+F1 shortcut not working on some fields in the help search", "description": "When using eclipse with DBCS locale, the Ctrl+F1 shortcut does not work on certain text fields in the Help search window.", "OB": "A help pop-up screen should appear displaying information about the Help search when pressing Ctrl+F1 on any text field in the Help search window.", "EB": "Currently, nothing happens when pressing Ctrl+F1 on the specified text field in the Help search window.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.
2. From the menu bar, select Search -> Help.
3. When the Help search window appears, click on the first text field and press Ctrl+F1.

The expected behavior is that a help pop-up screen should appear, displaying information about the Help search. The actual behavior is that nothing happens. This issue occurs with all DBCS languages. The problem is specifically isolated to the first text field in the Help search window, as the Ctrl+F1 shortcut functions properly when cycling through the other fields using the tab key."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '35156', 'title': 'Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.Execution result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly. '}
